body:
> You mention the List data structure, but there is no such data structure in Go.

I am referring to the built-in implementation of the [doubly linked list](https://golang.org/pkg/container/list/) package. I think the template system will automatically start supporting it (unless there is hardcoded restriction to certain data structures) if the required iterator functionality is added to the List implementation.

I am not much aware of the Go internals as I am new to this language, but I am thinking along the lines of how Sorting functionality is added to any arbitrary struct by attaching the necessary interface to it.
